overview_of_class: This course provides an overview of the main developments in Russian literature from the formation of the Soviet Union up to its collapse in the early 1990s. We will consider the influence of key historical and cultural events on artistic production, investigating the interconnection between literature and ideology. Students can expect to gain a foundational knowledge of the history of the Soviet Union, an understanding of the changes in the literary climate throughout the history of Soviet Russia, and a fundamental set of skills in literary analysis that will prove valuable in future reading of works of fiction. Writers examined include Erofeev, Sinyavsky/Terz, Shalamov, Rasputin, Pelevin, and others, as well as Nobel Prize winners Solzhenitsyn and Sholokhov.
name: 20th-Century Russian Literature
subject: SLAVIC
